findings.title: BC - Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop addresses from transactions. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `blacklistAddress` function.

findings.title: OCTD - Transfers Contract's Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to claim all the balance of the contract by calling the `withdrawTokens` function.

findings.title: RVD - Redundant Variable Declaration
findings.description: The contract contains a redundant `DECIMALS` variable set to 18, which is not used in calculations or functions, instead hardcoded as `10**18`. This adds unnecessary complexity and could lead to confusion about the contract's design and tokenomics.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version (i.e., any version that is a higher minor or patch version) can be used to compile the contract. The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.
